alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 09 at 9:10PM MDT until May 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FADING THIS EVENING BUT WILL RETURN ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... .Critical fire weather conditions will return to South Park and areas southwest through southeast of Denver on Tuesday. On Wednesday the hot, dry, and windy conditions will be even more widespread, affecting all of the plains and the foothills and mountain valleys as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 246 AND 247...EASTERN ELBERT AND LINCOLN COUNTIES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 246 and 247. * Timing...Red Flag Warning in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect for Wednesday. * Winds...South winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph Tuesday. Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph Wednesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent. * Impacts...Any fire that starts will have the potential to spread rapidly. Avoid burning or any outdoor activity that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
